channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: @KenSmith I absolutely do that. I think of it as taking a problem for a bike ride or a walk, or sleeping on it. But I didn't write this up well because I was describing something else. Maybe this is something I should do a quick podcast for.
The medical establishment gaslights doctors, insisting long Covid is "psychological." https://t.co/46bSfQvVYk
One thing that seems evident after the Putin attack on Ukraine. The only people outside the US who want the Repubs to win are the other despots whose people would kill them if they could.
How Republican dirty tricks paved the way for Russian meddling in 2016. https://t.co/D8NqaPcLqq
In Watergate, we got a perp walk, and the equivalent of an execution. https://t.co/LQnXcaXJNI

Can you imagine how the rest of the world sees the January 6 attack on the US Capitol? Spoiler: It scares the shit out of them. Because the main product the US sells is safety. Our financial system is where the world stores their money for safe keeping.
What scares them even more? We haven't done anything about it. Trump and all the people who organized the attempted coup are free. No prospect of any punishment. The can do it again and again.
If you're smart you're looking for the next safe place to put your savings.
I want to know this -- why isn't journalism running constant articles, reports and panels on this topic:
WHEN WILL TRUMP BE CHARGED?
Here's the piece that came from this thread.
https://t.co/JN6KZtDvtU
Meta Open-sources Browser Extension to Establish Web Code Authenticity. https://t.co/pf5TI4Ya5X
Incredible #knicks tonight.
Ice shelf collapses in previously stable East Antarctica. https://t.co/s3NZt9K4l0
@RoamResearch It's weird that @conaw has me blocked. I imagine it must be a mistake? ;-)
1995: We Make Shitty Software. https://t.co/HHyRsTY4H7
I hope the Knicks bring back Derrick Rose next season. https://t.co/Cc2PthdjdQ
Are Supreme Court justices above the law. Can they be arrested and prosecuted, convicted, punished? https://t.co/oiupCtXQGc

When I finish a programming session, the top note in my outline is always how I'm going to start the next session. Otherwise I get the "staring at a blank sheet of paper" thing. My judgement on the next thing is much better at the end than at the beginning of a session.

@berzerkeley it's a big thing. we think other people are responsible because we were infants once, and our basic ideas were formed then, and at that time our happiness was in fact in the hands of someone else.
Tesla fired an employee after he posted driverless tech reviews on YouTube. https://t.co/k5klKkwkZ0

When we got to the bottom of why people hated us for hosting their blogs for free it was this. They thought that if they did a blog, people would listen to them. They thought we were promising that (we weren't we had no illusions about that).
Another thing to learn from. When you ship a new product, think carefully about what features you want to implement first, so early users get an idea where the product is going. What its "vector" is long-term, because as we know, software is a process, not a thing.
The idea that software is a process was the big idea in "We Make Shitty Software" in September 1995.
Here's a screen shot of the relevant portion.
https://t.co/HHyRsTXwRz https://t.co/ZaeBwQaaGA
I got a lot of shit from devs who said they don't make shitty software, but in fact, they do. All devs do. Those that don't know they do don't know to set up a process that accounts for the shittiness of their software.
A corollary -- Some of the shittiest software is made by devs who think their software isn't shitty.

@AFP Wouldn't it be cool if we had a channel that could speak directly to the Russian people to tell them that many of us in the US are of Russian descent, we celebrate the culture, but we can't have you guys invading sovereign countries, and that's our main problem with Russia.

Today’s announcement targets interoperability of messaging apps like WhatsApp, Facebook Messenger, and iMessage, with the EU saying that vendors will have to “open up and interoperate with smaller messaging platforms, if they so request.” https://t.co/3M2qHNJY4X
Let’s get the same thing going with Facebook.
50 Best Movie Plot Twists of All Time. https://t.co/vjGXsAyQt4
When are they going to convict Trump? https://t.co/o4JyZ01GHD
How Putin misjudged the West’s response to the Ukraine invasion, explained by Timothy Snyder. https://t.co/eUR7TIKGJL
What do you think of Twitter communities?
Have you ever heard of cable TV news interviewer ask a question that they didn’t already know the answer to?
